column4: Ok, for the last 24hrs, i have really been having issues with booting up in Ubuntu 7.10... it is literally taking 15mins to get the login screen and prior to that it just remains black without any log or description as to why its taking so long. Help!
did it ever boot properly in the past ?
it didnt ever have a splash screen (apparently with wide screen notebooks that is a known problem) but before it would like within 5mins
open /boot/grub/menu.lst and add nosplash to the line for booting ubuntu, see if it helps
the line currently says   /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.22-14-generic root=UUID=c212f47a-6ac8-4d76-ad03-619b97a22b10 ro quiet splash
remove the splash word
so just /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.22-14-generic root=UUID=c212f47a-6ac8-4d76-ad03-619b97a22b10 ro quiet ?
looks about right
give it a try
that worked, it now shows each loading line....
why would splash cause it not to load for 15mins though?
but does it boot at a resonable spead ?
did yo change the splash ?
yes, within 30 secs it went to a terminal login prompt
not at all....
I wuld assumethat the splash file might be corupted
I came in through out the day in here, asking how i can get my splash screen to work, because it was always black, but on my desktop i'd get the ubuntu splash screen
anyway i can correct that?
I'll get ubotu to give you a link with theme stuff in it, in there you have instrucitons to change splash screens,  try to see if you can make something of that
